comments: L(n) has the amazing asymptotic development L(n)= e+ c(1)/n+c(2)/n^2+c(3)/n^3+... with c(1)=e(e+1)/2/(e-1) c(2)=e(11*e^3+3*e^2-51*e-11)/24/(e-1)^3 etc, where e =exp(1).
references: "A sequence convergent to Napier's Constant" by Alexandru Lupas from the University "Lucian Blaga" of Sibiu / e-mail : lupas(AT)jupiter.sibiu.ro
prog: (PARI) a(n) = numerator(sum(k = 1, n, k^n)/sum(k = 1, n-1, k^n)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 21 2013
author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 04 2002
